clinical_study.brief_title: Use of Masks on Metabolic Parameters and Inspiratory Muscle Strength During Aerobic Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Different Masks on Metabolic Parameters, Inspiratory Muscle Strength and Perceived Effort During Low Intensity Aerobic Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study will be to assess the effects of the use of masks on inspiratory muscle strength, metabolic parameters, heart rate, subjective perception of effort and the sensation of dyspnea before, during and after an aerobic test of 30 minutes long and a fixed load at lactate threshold. A randomized study of repeated measures will be carried out. A total sample of 35 active participants will be recruited. All participants will carried out a lactate threshold test and then 3 visits to the laboratory (separated at least 48 hours from each other) in order to perform 3 test of 30 minutes long without mask, with a surgical mask or with a FFP2 respirator (in a randomized order) at an intensity around lactate threshold intensity. Maximal inspiratory pressure, oxygen saturation, heart rate, blood lactate concentration, subjective perception of effort and dyspnea will be assessed before, during and after the 3 fixed intensity tests.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline inspiratory muscle strength after the 30 minutes test
primary_outcome.description: Inspiratory muscle strength will be measured in mmHg with a Power-breathe device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline after 10 minutes, 20 minutes and 30 minutes during the test
secondary_outcome.description: lactate concentration will be measured in mmol/L with a Lactate Pro 2 device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline after 10 minutes, 20 minutes and 30 minutes during the test
secondary_outcome.description: oxygen saturation will be measured in %

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline after 10 minutes, 20 minutes and 30 minutes during the test
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate will be measured in beats per minute with a polar H10 device

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline after 10 minutes, 20 minutes and 30 minutes during the test
secondary_outcome.description: rate of perceived effort will be obtained through the Borg´ scale

secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline after 10 minutes, 20 minutes and 30 minutes during the test
secondary_outcome.description: sensation of dyspnea will be obtained through a visual analog scale from 0 to 10 points

arm_group.description: Using of FFP2 respirator during the 30 minutes test
Using of surgical mask during the 30 minutes test
The 30 minutes test will be carried out without mask

intervention.intervention_name: steady intensity aerobic test of 30 minutes long
intervention.description: the use of different type of masks during an aerobic exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- carrying out at least 2 days of physical activity per week
Exclusion Criteria:
- cardiac disease
- pulmonary disease
- chronic inflammatory disease
- sedentary behaviour
